line_1: Save where the dry Harmattan breathes and kills;
line_2: When not a gale flits o'er her tawny hills,

line_1: Who first insults the victim whom he kills;
line_2: A potent quack, long versed in human ills,

line_1: Too well you know, that Beauty often kills:
line_2: But ah! not rashly trust the tempting Ills;

line_1: Gives Grief, or Pleasure; spares, or kills.
line_2: Directs his Arrow as She wills;
